page.title: 02Shopping habits.
page.content: In a survey of shopping habits carried out by students of the Sixth Form College in Spring 1983, it was found that some half of the people interviewed who lived in Gorleston did their main convienience shopping for foodstuffs in the town, but a considerable preferred Yarmouth with it's greater range of larger supermarkets. For household goods however, the size and quality of Gorleston's stores was not attractive and Yarmouth as well as Lowestoft and Norwich tended to be more frquented. The same trend was even more apparent when clothing was bought. It was noted that there had been a change however with Yarmouth becoming less popular due to the problems of and cost of parking there as well as the difficulties of access along one road and the only bridge, the Haven Bridge.
